author: ajsutton
content: Geth's CI can't possibly have picked this up - the tests would have had the same, incorrect, understanding of the calculation to be done and thus just verified that it performed incorrectly.  There's a missing reference test covering this case which will be added as a result of discovering this. I guess the key point I'm trying to get across is that these kinds of consensus failures always have a lot more details than they first appear. It's extremely difficult to evaluate the severity of a bug or the risk of other bugs like it unless you understand all those details. So I wouldn't freak out over this, just let the people who do know it well work through it.
